thread.title: Lion boys roar to first win, Vikings net seventh victory
thread.title_full: Lion boys roar to first win, Vikings net seventh victory

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Lion boys roar to first win, Vikings net seventh victory
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Lion boys roar to first win, Vikings net seventh victory Several Waldo County teams in postseason position By Staff | Oct 07, 2015 
The regular season is winding down for the seven Waldo County high school boys and girls soccer squads â€” with about half of those teams jockeying for postseason position. 
The Searsport boys and girls are entrenched in the playoff picture as are the Mount View girls, while the Mustang boys along with both Belfast boys and girls squads will be playing for pride over the final games of the season. 
The Islesboro coed team also is in the playoff picture. 
In Oct. 6 contests, the Viking and Lion boys cemented wins, while the Lion girls and both Mustang squads were dealt losses. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Boys soccer 
Searsport 3, Bucksport 0 
At Bucksport Oct. 6, the Vikings blanked the Golden Bucks as they prevailed by three goals. 
Connor Kneeland had two goals and one assist in the win, while Dean Evans also creased the net for Searsport. 
Ben Powell and George Dakin combined for the shutout in net as the duo made eight saves on 10 shots for Searsport. Cody Larsen and Jakob Donnell combined for seven saves on 13 shots in goal for Bucksport. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Searsport (7-2-1, 49.4388 points) is fourth, while Buckfield (10-1, 70.1559 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Belfast 3, Morse 2 
At Belfast Oct. 6, the Lions clawed to their first win of the season as they edged the Shipbuilders. 
Skylar Perkins creased the net twice for Belfast, while Garrett Hamlin added one goal and Sean Kennedy one assist. 
For Morse, Zidane McMurrin scored a goal for the visitors. 
Hamlin tallied the game-winner with 8:35 left to go in regulation. 
Andrew Cross made eight saves on 22 shots in net for the Lions, while Alex Fernald made eight saves on 14 shots in goal for the Shipbuilders. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (1-9, 6.7857 points) is 17th, while Ellsworth (9-0-1, 85.4847 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Waterville 6, Mount View 2 
At Thorndike Oct. 6, the Purple Panthers prowled past the host Mustangs. 
Michael Olivera scored five goals in the win for Waterville, while Peter Mayhorn added one. 
Mikey Hustus scored both goals for the hosts. 
Mount View held an 8-7 edge in shots, while Waterville ended with a 2-1 advantage in corner kicks. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Mount View (2-9, 6.7858 points) is 18th, while Ellsworth (9-0-1, 85.4847 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Girls soccer 
Morse 4, Belfast 2 
At Bath Oct. 6, the Shipbuilders scored three unanswered goals in the second half and doubled up the Lions. Belfast led 2-1 at halftime. 
Cassidy Hill and Lydia Violette scored for Belfast, while Faith Beaulieu added an assist. 
For Morse, Macie Gagne scored three goals and Megan Curtis one, while Emma Rossetti, Amanda Gagne, Ella Martin, Sierra Wallace and Alika McMurrin had one assist. 
Morse held a 30-13 edge in shots and a 9-2 advantage in corner kicks. 
Marissa Parks made six saves in net for the Shipbuilders, while Shera Hilt and Cori Shooter combined to make 13 saves in goal. Hilt was injured early in the second half and was forced to leave the game. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (1-9, 1.9388 points) is 18th, while Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston (9-0-1, 96.9388 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
